channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A meeting with the Governor’s Office and an altered public document: How Elon Musk’s Boring Company got three safety violations rescinded in 24 hours
item.description: Lawyers and regulators say the Nevada state agency’s handling of the safety investigation went against procedure.

item.title: Trump continues hammering MTG after she labels his attacks 'a dog whistle to dangerous radicals'
item.description: President Donald Trump called Republican Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia a "Traitor" to the U.S. in a Truth Social post on Sunday

item.title: Trump calls on House Republicans to vote to release Epstein files: 'We have nothing to hide'
item.description: President calls Epstein file controversy a "Democrat hoax" while pushing GOP lawmakers to vote for full release of related documents and materials.

item.title: Today’s corporate boards look like the past: older directors, more male appointees, and less turnover
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Women Need Good Men
item.description: Love is the antidote to our poisonous culture of abortion.

item.description: It would behoove the administration to apply the logic of the latest relief more broadly.

item.title: Visa leans into AI-enabled payments and stablecoins to stay ahead of the game in Asia
item.description: One thing missing from current chatbots is "the ability to make payment via an agent,” said Asia-Pacific president Stephen Karpin.

item.title: The U.S. aims to breathe easy amid China’s chokehold on rare earths, but loosening the grip takes years of concerted effort
item.description: U.S. races to establish rare earths supply chains domestically and abroad in "Cold War 2.0."

item.title: What 60 Minutes Got Wrong About Harvard and the Biomedical Research Enterprise
item.description: A recent segment was a sad attempt to cloak the shortcomings of academic science in hype, sentimentality, and public relations theater.

item.title: Sen. Tim Kaine defends Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer from liberal backlash
item.description: Sen. Tim Kaine of Virginia pushed back Sunday against liberal critics of Senate Minority Leader Charles E. Schumer.

item.title: An Addiction to Euphemism Is Corrupting Journalism — and Our Language

item.title: Ken Burns’ The American Revolution Kicks Off the Quarter-Millennial Celebrations

item.title: Yes, President Trump Can Pardon The 77 People Prosecuted For 2020 Election Integrity Efforts
item.description: Media wrongly insist that the pardon clause only applies to federal charges, yet every attempt to narrow the scope of pardons has failed.

item.title: With Jocelyn Benson Set To Referee Her Own Race For Governor, Michigan GOP Asks DOJ To Monitor Election
